## DurableContext.configureLogger() method

Configures logger behavior for this context

**Signature:**

```typescript
configureLogger(config: LoggerConfig<TLogger>): void;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

config

</td><td>

LoggerConfig&lt;TLogger&gt;

</td><td>

Logger configuration options

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

void

## Example

```typescript
// Set custom logger
const customLogger = {
  log: (level, message, data, error) =>
    console.log(`[${level}] ${message}`, data),
  error: (message, error, data) => console.error(message, error, data),
  warn: (message, data) => console.warn(message, data),
  info: (message, data) => console.info(message, data),
  debug: (message, data) => console.debug(message, data),
};
context.configureLogger({ customLogger });

// Disable mode-aware logging to see logs during replay
context.configureLogger({ modeAware: false });

// Both together
context.configureLogger({
  customLogger,
  modeAware: false,
});
```
